alert.note: Alert for Apple and Lucerne Valleys; San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued December 30 at 1:30PM PST until December 31 at 10:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...South to southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts 50 to 60 mph. Gusts to 75 mph possible along the desert slopes and desert foothill areas. * WHERE...San Bernardino County Mountains and Apple and Lucerne Valleys. Strongest winds near the desert slopes, but mountain wave activity could create bursts of the strong wind out onto the desert floor. * WHEN...Late Saturday morning through the evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain and fog, in addition to the wind, will create a hazard for New Year`s Eve travel. The snow level will begin above 7000 feet, but will fall after midnight, possibly icing up roads above 6000 feet.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Apple and Lucerne Valleys; San Bernardino County Mountains
